intro: Wahlenbergia tumida var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are upright and often branched. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
